heading: stocks hit record highs
subheading: wall street soars as investors revel in fresh merger activity and a surplus of ready cash. impeachment trial? what impeachment trial? by david lazarus.
author: david lazarus
text: wall street roared to record highs in mid-afternoon trading wednesday, fueled by ongoing merger activity, a windfall of ready cash, and the sort of irrational exuberance that makes a certain fed chief shake his head in bewilderment. tech and internet stocks led the way upward amid continued enthusiasm for electronic retailing and commerce.the dow jones industrial average gained 163.75 points to 9474.94, blowing past the 9400 mark for the first time ever, and the s&p 500 was 21.64 higher at 1266.42. the nasdaq composite index gained 61.14 to 2312.41, and the wired index was up 26.91 at 617.10."the fourth quarter was one of the best fourth quarters of the entire decade," said alexander paris sr., an analyst with barrington research. "also, there is traditionally a strong push in the market at this time of year."he cited a fresh supply of liquid funds now spilling into equities from 401k and pension plans. that, plus a general sense that us stocks remain the smartest bet for investors, will keep pushing share prices higher for the near term, paris believes.one small reality check: oklahoma-based phillips petroleum (p) cast some drizzle on the parade by announcing it will hand pink slips to about 1,400 workers and report a quarterly loss as a result of us$339 million in charges. while this doesn't send the most encouraging signal about long-term economic vitality, it came as welcome news to investors, who pushed phillips' stock up 69 cents to $43.31.meanwhile, back in the parallel universe occupied by internet shares, net service provider mindspring enterprises (mspg) jumped $7.44 to $74 as it shelled out approximately $245 million for icg communications' netcom subsidiary. icg (icgx), which will retain netcom's backbone network, shed 25 cents to $22.88.icg purchased netcom for $285 million exactly a year ago. since then, netcom subscribers found the service increasingly unreliable as the system struggled to keep pace with new area codes and demand for higher-speed access. rumors of netcom's sale have been floating around for months.industry leader america online (aol) climbed $4.25 to $151.19 as lehman brothers analyst brian oakes urged clients to hang on to all their shares in the company."even with the dramatic run-up in aol's stock, we believe it could be a mistake to sell one share, given the potential catalysts we see over the next six months," he said.one such catalyst is the prospect for continued consolidation among top net outfits. lycos (lcos), soon-to-be parent of wired news, has been the object of much speculation of late that a merger or acquisition is in the cards. its shares gained $8.13 to $60.50 as cs first boston initiated coverage of the company with a "buy" rating.in tech, apple computer (aapl) slipped $1.56 to $41.75 as cibc oppenheimer downgraded its rating for the company's stock to "underperform" from "hold." this follows a stream of positive news from the macworld expo in san francisco, where not-quite-ceo steve jobs unveiled five new colors for the popular imac and said apple is on course to post its fifth quarterly profit in a row.airtouch communications (ati), america's biggest wireless phone service, rose another $2.31 to $79.81 on hopes that a bidding war to acquire the company will drive its sale price through the roof. the two suitors, bell atlantic (bel) and vodafone group (vod), are said to be offering something in the range of $45 billion. bell's stock advanced $2.50 to $57.06, while vodafone was down 69 cents at $178.44.despite a denial from nissan motor that it's in talks with anyone about a buyout of the troubled automaker, daimlerchrysler (dcx) gained another $1.13 to $107.25 on speculation that it is indeed negotiating a deal. japanese companies routinely issue denials of such doings, as opposed to the western habit of not commenting on rumors.lastly, pro basketball players reportedly have agreed to terms that could salvage the remainder of the current season. nike (nke), which has seen its business nose-dive as a result of the dispute, rebounded $2.13 to $42.81.oh, and the president's impeachment trial starts thursday. like anyone cares.
